MANUAL: apt-data-subset (1.20.0)

Contents

  • Introduction.
  • Program Options - command line options.
  • FAQ - Frequently Asked Questions.

Introduction

apt-data-subset - Utility to create a sample data subset from a larger set of files.

Options:

apt-data-subset - Create a sample data subset from a larger set of files.
usage:
   apt-data-subset --spf file.spf --num 10000 --cel-file celfiles.txt --out-dir mydatadir --prefix 10k


options:
   -h, --help                           Display program options and extra
                          documentation about usage. [default 
                          'false'] 
   -v, --verbose How verbose to be with status messages 0 -
                          quiet, 1 - usual messages, 2 - more
                          messages. [default '1'] 
     --version Display version information. [default
                          'false'] 
     --cel-files Text file specifying cel files to process,
                          one per line with the first line being
                          'cel_files'. [default ''] 
     --out-lib-dir Directory to write result library files
                          into. [default ''] 
     --out-cel-dir Directory to write result celf files into.
                          [default ''] 
     --spf-file Spf file to read probesets data from.
                          [default ''] 
     --probeset-file List of probesets to use as sample. 
                          [default ''] 
     --prefix Prefix to tag on before file type suffix
                          [default ''] 
     --probeset-field Column name for probeset fields, usually
                          probeset_id or probeset_name [default
                          'probeset_id'] 
     --bgp-file File with GC background probes [default ''] 
     --meta-file Meta-probset file to be sampled from.
                          [default ''] 
     --pgf-file pgf-probset file to be sampled from.
                          [default ''] 
     --clf-file clf-probset file to be sampled from.
                          [default ''] 
     --kill-list-file file with kill-list probes to be sampled
                          from. [default ''] 
     --magic-order-column What column has the magic order for
                          copynumber. [default ''] 
     --magic-order-group What group in the file5 has the magic order
                          for copynumber. [default ''] 
     --magic-order-file What group in the file5 has the magic order
                          for copynumber. [default ''] 
     --qcc-file file with QC probesets to be sampled from.
                          [default ''] 
     --tsv-convert-files List of tsv based files to read from and
                          transform. [default ''] 
     --tsv-select-files List of tsv based files to set probesets
                          from. [default ''] 
     --file5-convert-files List of file5 based files to read from and
                          transform. [default ''] 
     --file5-select-files List of file5 based files to set probesets
                          from. [default ''] 
     --num Number of probesets to sample for creation.
                          [default '-1'] 
     --spf-version Which spf version to write. [default '1'] 
     --num-channels How many channels for the spf-file. 
                          [default '1']

Frequently Asked Questions

Q. What is a probe_id?

A. See the FAQ item on probe IDs for more info.

Q. I do not have a CDF file for the arrays I want to process. (WT based arrays have PGF/CLF files rather than CDF files)

A. You can still use this tool. Omit the CDF command line arg. Note that you will not be able to use ChipStream methods which require chip layout information. Most notably you cannot use the rma-bg method and you cannot use the pm-only option to quant-norm.

Q. How is the mask section in the CEL file used?

A. It is not. The contents of this section of the CEL file are ignored.

Q. Where can I get more information about what can be provided with --chipstream?

A. See the "Data transformations" section of the options in the apt-probeset-summarize manual. You can use the --explain option to apt-probeset-summarize to get further information on each of the transformation methods.
